Umberto Michieli
Ph.D. in Information Engineering
Download CV

About

I was born in Italy in 1994. I got my BS and MS respectively in Information Engineering (2016) and in Telecommunication Engineering (2018) from the University of Padova.
Now I am a Ph.D. student at the Department of Information Engineering of the same University under the supervision of Prof. Pietro Zanuttigh.

My research interests include applications of Game Theory, Semantic Segmentation and Deep Learning for images and videos, link-prediction in Complex Networks.
A particular attention is given to the adoption of Generative Adversarial Networks for semi-supervised Semantic Segmentation in order to dramatically reduce the number of training samples needed.

Check the publications section to know more about these topics and the Multimedia Technology and Telecommunication Lab at University of Padova.

LaTeX templates for BS and MS thesis

Here are reported the templates which I used for my BS and MS thesis. The second one is an evolution of the other and it is richer. Those are not official templates and they can be adapted to different requirements.

[MS] Michieli U., "Link Prediction on Real and Synthetic Complex Networks", MS Thesis in Telecommunication Engineering, Department of Information Engineering, University of Padova, September 2018, [PDF], [LaTeX template] [slides].

[BS] Michieli U., "Correlation and Coherence Analysis between EEG and EMG signals", BS Thesis in Information Engineering, Department of Information Engineering, University of Padova, July 2016, [PDF] [LaTeX template] [slides].

Selection of MS Course Projects

Network Science:

Analisys of the network topology in men's single tennis matches. Read more in [ArXiV], [HW1] and [HW2]. The networks used in this report are collected in [dataset].

Computer Vision:

Images merging and Object Recognition in images and video using SURF, SIFT and LBP. Read the report [PDF].

Wireless Communications:

Modeling of Markov fading wireless channel, in collaboration with Ettore Mariotti and Pietro Tonello. Read the report [PDF].

Telecommunication Networks:

Coexistence of Machine-to-Machine and Human-to-Human types of communication in LTE networks (analysis conducted in ns-3), in collaboration with Mattia Lecci and in collaboration with Matteo Ciprian. Read the report [PDF] or have a look at the [slides] of the presentation.

Source Coding:

Implementation of the LBG algorithm for CD-quality audio signals compression. Read the report [PDF] or have a look at the [slides] of the presentation.

Telemedicine:

Literature overview on closed-loop deep brain stimulation, in collaboration with Matilde Boschiero. Read the report [PDF] or have a look at the [slides] of the presentation.

Awards

aug 2018 - Awarded fellowship from the organizers of "The Cornell, Maryland, Max Planck Pre-doctoral Research School", Saarbrucken.
jul 2018 - Awarded fellowship granted by Technische Universitat Dresden (TUD) for "International School and Conference on Network Science (NetSci)", Paris.
2018 - Awarded scholarship grant "Mille e una lode" for merit, offered by University of Padova.
2017 - Finalist at "Accenture Innovation Game", business game of project management, Milan.
